row.entry: This action is used to set the activation event for the BOU bundle.
This action is used to set the activation fee for a BOU bundle.
This action is used to set the discount for a BOU bundle.
This action is used to count the number of times a BOU bundle is activated.
This action is used to add any existing AVP in dictionary or the Vendor Specific AVP (VSA) at root level or MSCC level.
This action is used to add a new CDR tag with value, it is a command level.
This action is used to set announcement AVP to the MSCC level.
This action is used to set variable-part AVP in the announcement AVP.
This action is used to set the 5G trigger type, trigger category, and trigger level that can cause the credit control client to reauthorize the associated quota.
A value which represents the country of call.

entry.p: This action is used in a rule table or in default actions of the Credit Request Profile to provide a time value assigned to the Request Time. If this action is not used in a rule table/default action in the Credit Request Profile, then the default value (Event-Time-Stamp AVP) is assigned to request time.
If the request time value is not set by an action or the Event-Time-Stamp AVP is not present in the CCR message, the local system time is used to provide the time of day functionality.

The AVP carries the default request time info as Event-Time-Stamp in CCR. The Diameter stack decodes it into the UTC epoc time in milliseconds. Call controller uses the value in this AVP as Request Time and passes it to Rating.
The possible user-defined values are either Event-Time-Stamp or the value of Local-System-Time, as follows:

row.entry: The roaming status of the current device.
A STRING value as defined by a Credit Request Profile rule or STRING value determined using a rule variable.
Entered as a user-defined STRING value

entry.p: Defined from service-context-id AVP and rating group to specify SMS or PS type calls.
An ENUM value as defined by a Credit Request Profile rule or an ENUM value determined using a rule variable.

row.entry: A value used to represent one or more zones.
Can be a STRING or a list of STRINGS that are type/value pairs.
The value to set for the CC-Session-Failover AVP in the CCA.
The value to set for the Credit-Control-Failure-Handling AVP in the CCA.

entry.p: One of the following entered as an ENUM value:

row.entry: This action is used when the value of the action Call-Roaming-Status cannot be determined from the other source.
This action is used when the system cannot get the charging zones.

li.p: DROP_CALL: When the system cannot get the charging zones, reject the request.
DEFAULT_ZONE: If the system cannot get the charging zones, then set the charging zone to the default zone.

row.entry: The value to set for the Direct-Debiting-Failure-Handling AVP in the CCA.
This action is used to have a single CDR for the complete call. It is not applicable for Gy session calls.
This represents the type of unit for the call, which can be VOLUME, TIME, UNIT or MONEY.

Provides the name of complex map which is used to map the external policy counter ID with internal policy counter IDs. It is preconfigured in the Rules and Variables with default value PolicyCounterIdMap.
This represents the type of RSU unit, which can be VOLUME, TIME, UNIT, or MONEY.
The Trigger-Type AVP indicates the events that can cause the credit control client to reauthorize the associated quota.
This action defines the name of the algorithm that is configured such as BASIC_ALGO, BUCKET_ALGO, and DYNAMIC_ALGO.
This action defines the maximum number of users for the group resource defined in the slicing profile rule.
This action is the minimum slice size defined for the slicing profile.
This action defines the minimum tariff time change value in seconds.
This action defines the minimum validity time in seconds.
This action defines the quota holding time in seconds and controls the time the session remains in idle state in the network.

entry.p: This action supports DYNAMIC_ALGO_2 and contains the following parameters:

li.p: Algo-Name: Currently we support only DYNAMIC_ALGO_2 which is case-insensitive.
Min Slice: Min Slice is an optional parameter which indicates a minimum Slice size to be provided.
Max Slice: Max Slice is an optional parameter which restricts the size of Slice from Algorithm if provided. Supports a Max value up to 9223372036854775807 (Max value of Long) for Max Slice Value.

row.entry: This action defines the value calculated on the delta between the current usage and threshold value.
This action defines the slice size in bytes which is always greater than zero.
This action defines the value of the validity time in seconds.

entry.p: This action is used when the Credit Control client seeks re-authorization from the server for the quota when the quota falls below the supplied threshold.
Threshold must be defined on quantity (volume only) and it is reserved and granted in CCA. Value of VQT can be configured in percentage (%) or in fixed value.
Depending on the type of algorithm used, the Volume-Quota-Threshold parameter is calculated and sent back to the network in CCA message.
This action attribute is added to the slicing profile rule under Dynamic_Slice and can have one of the following values:

li.p: FIXED_ADD_IN_GSU: When configured as FIXED_ADD_IN_GSU, then the Volume-Quota-Threshold parameter in slicing profile rule specifies the absolute value used to set AVP in CCA message sent back to the network. It is added to the derived quota amount to determine the GSU value when GSU is not a final slice.
PERCENTAGE: When configured as PERCENTAGE, the Volume-Quota-Threshold parameter value in slicing profile rule is configured in % and calculated on the granted volume quota sent in CCA message.

entry.p: By default, the value of this action attribute is set as PERCENTAGE to achieve the existing slice reduction functionality.
This parameter is also defined per MSCC or rating group. Depending on the type of algorithm used, the Volume-Quota-Threshold parameter is calculated and sent back to the network in CCA message.

row.entry: It is a place holder for GY_POST_PROCESSING rule attribute.
Rule Attribute Name to set the APN in Gy Pre-Processing Rule for getting CDR Index Id from the CDR Mapping table.
This action is used to disable dumping all the charging CDR.
Once the rules are evaluated and FUI/FUA is got in result, FUI/FUA object is created and set to the corresponding MSCC.
No CDR is generated for notification.
This attribute disables EDR for notification action in a lifecycle.
This action is used to send a notification and continue using the resource.
This action is used to send a notification and reject the call.
This action is used to send a notification and stop using the resource and then shift to next resource if any.
This action is used to reject the call.
This action is used to send a notification when you intend to notify subscribers about a specific event.
This notification is used to send the RAR. The value should be SendRAR, that is, NOTIFICATION.Send-RAR = SendRAR.

entry.p: This attribute is disabled by default but can be enabled using a rule. For any notification variable in a template, reports the notification content as variables and value pairs.

You can use the notification variables available and custom notification variables that you add, to return specific information in your message. For example, you can use the Notification Variables: Subscriber-User-Id and 3GPP-User-Location-Info along with a custom Notification Variable that you have defined (in this example, Customized-Date(2)) to return the Subscriber-User-Id and location information with the current system time in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
Custom Notification Variables must be added to the charging Rule Attribute Dictionary before you can use them.
The following lists default notification variables used:

row.entry: Bucket Selection is an action attribute info name defined within the RATING result context. It signifies the output of tariff rule as bucket. Bucket should be non-monetary only. For monetary buckets, RATING.Rate is used.
Input a bucket name as a data string.

This is an action attribute info name defined within the RATING result context. It signifies whether the charging service configured for different conditions is evaluated and results in True or False accordingly.
This is an action attribute defined within the RATING result context, signifies whether the counter is applicable or not.
This is an action attribute info name defined within the RATING result context. It signifies the output of tariff rule as Counter. It can have accumulation of usage/cost.
Input a counter name as a data list string.

Once the rules are evaluated and FUI/FUA is got in result, FUI/FUA object is created and set to the corresponding MSCC. It contains three parameters for redirect: (RedirectServerAddress_STRING, ValidityTime_LONG, and RedirectAddressType_ENUM).
Once the rules are evaluated and FUI/FUA is got in result, FUI/FUA object is created and set to the corresponding MSCC with action as terminate. It is without parameter for final unit action.
This is an action attribute info name defined within the RATING result context. It signifies the output of the tariff rule in case of free calling.

Rate is an action attribute info name defined within the RATING result context. It signifies the output tariff rule as rate. It is always applied to the monetary resource that is, bucket of monetary type or account balance).

entry.p: The Target_STRING is a text string to be parsed.
A reference to an existing child rule table.

You can have multiple instances of the DSC.Rule-Table action in the same rule, which allows you to configure the rule table as the parent rule table from which, depending on the conditions met, the actions of existing child rule tables are executed. When the parent runs and the criteria are met, all of the child rule tables are evaluated, and their results are merged using the following criteria:

li.p: If an action is only returned by one of the rule tables, use the value.
If an action is returned by more than one rule table, and the action can have multiple values, combine all of the values into a single collection of values and use the result.

If an action is returned by more than one rule table, and the action can only have one value, the first value returned for this action is used. Note that since actions are not provisioned in a set order, this order may not be consistent.

entry.p: After all of the actions have been collected using the above criteria, they are all applied as if those same actions were provisioned in the rule. During this step, the previous merging strategy is used, so if an action already has a value the new value is ignored. This may also produce inconsistent results since there is no way to guarantee the order in which actions in a rule are applied.

row.entry: This parameter indicates a rule condition expression evaluated to determine whether the taxation is applicable. The default applicability condition for taxation is true.

The taxation can be attached or detached to a bundle or an account to implement the tax. The taxation profile entity includes multiple percentage tax rates and applicability condition. If the taxation reference is not provided in the charging service tariff rule, then the taxation does not apply.
This action is used to set the value of roaming status based on the condition criteria.
Type of call value to be set in action.
It is the first entry of Service-Information/IMS-Information/Called-Party-Address.
A string that contains information about called party country name.
Enum to recognize the Called-Party Type.
It is the first entry of Service-Information/IMS-Information/Calling-Party-Address.
Enum to recognize the Calling-Party Type.
Checks whether the called and calling party are onNet or Offnet and respectively returns a Boolean value.
Mobile Country Code used to identify user location.
Concatenated string of MCC and MNC.
Mobile Network Code used to identify user location.
Enum used to identify the radio access technology that is serving the UE.
Used to set the result code at the root level.
SDP-Media-Name AVP contains information about Media type.
Flag indicating if overage is enabled.
List to specify Category Order traversal specified by Device.
The Counter Ids directly associated to this device without subscription.
The time (epoch) when this device was created.

This action is used to attach the Custom data which is already defined in the system to device. If this Custom Data already existed in the device, the service updates the value of Custom Data in the device.

entry.p: This action is used to attach the custom Data which is already defined in the system to device. If this Custom Data already existed in the device, the service updates the value of Custom Data in the device.
The result of this action is immediately available for subsequent rule processing.

row.entry: This action is used to remove a custom data of a device.
This action is used to remove a custom data of a device.
The record type of the device.
The external ID of the device.
Flag to indicate if the device is barred.
Checks the Bundle-Name passed in the argument in the parent group on entity for which this threshold is configured.
Checks the Bundle pass in argument in Entity itself for which threshold is configured.
Checks the Bundle-Name passed in the argument on top group of hierarchy for which this threshold is configured.
Flag to indicate that device is used first time in call.
Flag that indicate that device is used first time in call request or it is previously called.
The time (epoch) when this device was updated.
Flag to indicate whether the Device is searched from Ldap or not.
The Notification Profile associated to this Device.
The host name of the OCS.
The realm of the OCS site.
Device off line time (last termination time).
Device password for Wireline subscriber device.
Flag to indicate whether the stored password encrypted or not.
This action is used to access a custom data of a device.
Index used for sorting the device subscriptions for rating along with Group subscriptions.
Flag indicating if integration with OCS through Sy is enabled.
Indicates which component triggers this attribute updates.
The applicable Usage Control Service for this device.
It has the name of the UCS subscribed by the device.
Ids of Device Counters associated to this group.
Set of Device Id attached with the group.
Set of Child Device Names attached with the group.
Set of Child Group Id attached with the group.
Set of Child Group Names attached with the group.
The time (epoch) when this group was created.
Used to attach the Custom Data which is already defined in system to group. If this Custom Data already existed in the group, the service updates the value of Custom Data in the group.
Used to attach the Custom Data which is already defined in system to group. If this Custom Data already existed in the group, the service updates the value of Custom Data in the group.
This action is used to remove a custom data of a group.
This action is used to remove a custom data of a group.
Ids of Counters associated with group.
Checks the Bundle-Name passed in the argument in Entity for which this threshold is configured.
Checks the Bundle-Name passed in the argument in Parent group on entity for which this threshold is configured.
Checks the Bundle-Name passed in the argument on top group of hierarchy for which this threshold is configured.
The time (epoch) when this group was updated.
The Notification Profile associated to this Group.
This action is used to access a custom data of a group.
It has the name of the UCS subscribed by the group.
This action alters the policy counter Id in the SLR (two parameters: old counter Id and new counter Id).
This action alters the policy counter status of a given counter Id in SNR (two parameters: Counter Id and Counter Status - Counter status updated by Counter Id).
This action removes a matching policy counter Id from SLR or SNR (one parameter: counter Id).
This action discards policy counter Id from being included in the SNR Policy-Counter-Status-Report when the old and new states are identical.
This action discards the entire SNR message
Sets the dummy action interval by variable name and value.
This action calculates the length of input string.
Notification-Destination is an action attribute info name that indicates whether the notification must be sent to a group or device based on the value defined.
Threshold-Crossed is an action attribute info name defined within the Threshold result context. It signifies that the flag indicating threshold applied to bucket/counter has been crossed or not.
Input as a ThresholdName_STRING or RecurrenceCount_STRING.
Threshold Profile Interval Count is an action attribute info name defined within the Threshold result context. It signifies the interval count of the threshold profile configured.
Indicates whether the threshold is triggered by a call or provisioning task.

entry.p: Schedule-Event is an action attribute to support the time management in counters. The syntax for this action is:
TIME_VALUE is the length of the period, TIME_UNIT is the period unit such as Day, Week, and Action is the action to perform such as Reset.
